title: At the Restaurant
description: Improve your French speaking skills with phrases commonly used at the restaurant. Focus on clear pronunciation and polite intonation.
instructions: Below, you'll find a list of common phrases you might use at a restaurant in French.
Your task is to record yourself speaking each phrase.
Ensure your pronunciation matches the provided text as closely as possible.
Try to maintain a natural and clear speaking pace.
After recording each phrase, listen to your recording and compare it to the text.
Focus on intonation, clarity, and fluency.
Repeat the recording process as many times as needed to improve your pronunciation.

items.question: Je voudrais une table pour deux, s'il vous plaît.
items.answer: Je voudrais une table pour deux, s'il vous plaît.

items.question: Un verre d'eau, s'il vous plaît.
items.answer: Un verre d'eau, s'il vous plaît.

scoring.8-10 correct pronunciations: Excellent! Your pronunciation is clear and accurate. You demonstrate a strong command of restaurant-related French.
scoring.5-7 correct pronunciations: Good! Your pronunciation is mostly correct, with a good grasp of dining phrases in French. There are some areas to refine for improved clarity.
scoring.2-4 correct pronunciations: Fair. You can navigate basic restaurant conversations in French, but there are several areas needing significant improvement.
scoring.0-1 correct pronunciations: Needs improvement. Consider practicing more to enhance your French pronunciation skills, or seek additional resources for learning.
